p: Another method to link fragments is to extract all information obtained from an assembly by looking at the original contig graphs (Mulyukov and Pevzner, 2002). Information on adjacency of contigs can be found in such graphs and extracted for genome finishing. This method has successfully been applied when sequencing the gram-negative bacteria Rickettsia prowazekii (Nagarajan et al., 2010). Contig adjacency information is especially useful if repeats exist that are longer than the read length, and contigs were split at positions where the reconstruction was ambiguous.
